page.title: 01Oxon/Warks Border N Banbury
page.content: Block bisected N-s by A41. Runs on ridge. Valleys of agricultural and pasture land with some spinneys both sides. Sor brook runs through to Cheswell. Land grade 2 or 3. Some hedges removed. New coppice planting. All arable crops grown. Sheep, beef and pigs. No dairying. Abundent wildlife, foxes, badgers, large variety of birds and insects. Villages of Shotteswell and Hanwell east of road. Horley west. All built Horton stone. Population of each approximately 300. About 20 employed in agriculture between three villages. Remaining employed travel to Banbury Oxford and Leamington. High population retired residents. Most cottages modernised to high standard. No large new housing estates.
